rules.rule_text_en: Use a/an with singular countable nouns when we mean one thing (often for the first time).
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай a/an із злічуваними іменниками в однині, коли йдеться про одну річ (часто при першій згадці).
examples: I bought a new phone yesterday.
There’s a cat in the garden.

rules.rule_text_en: Use some with plural countable nouns and with uncountable nouns when we mean ‘a quantity’ (not exact).
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай some зі злічуваними в множині та з незлічуваними, коли мається на увазі певна кількість (не точно).
examples: I need some eggs and some milk.
We bought some furniture for the flat.

rules.rule_text_en: Some is common in offers and requests: Would you like some…? Can I have some…?
rules.rule_text_uk: Some часто вживається в пропозиціях і проханнях: Would you like some…? Can I have some…?
examples: Can I have some water, please?

rules.rule_text_en: Use a/an when we mention something for the first time; use the when we mention the same thing again.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай a/an, коли згадуєш щось уперше; вживай the, коли згадуєш це знову.
examples: I saw a dog. The dog was very friendly.
She bought a bag. The bag was expensive.
There was an email. The email was from my boss.

rules.rule_text_en: Use the when the listener can identify which thing you mean (because it’s known from the situation or context).
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай the, коли співрозмовник може зрозуміти, про яку саме річ ідеться (відомо з ситуації/контексту).
examples: Could you close the window? (the one here)
I’ll meet you at the station.

rules.rule_text_en: Use a/an when we mean ‘one of many’ and it doesn’t matter which one.
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай a/an, коли мається на увазі «один із багатьох» і не важливо який саме.
examples: She wants to buy a car. (not a particular one)

rules.rule_text_en: Use the for something unique (the sun, the equator) and with superlatives (the best, the longest).
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай the з унікальними речами (the sun, the equator) і з найвищим ступенем (the best, the longest).
examples: What’s the most expensive hotel here?
She lives on the top floor.

rules.rule_text_en: The can mean a specific thing; a/an means one example. Sometimes the changes the meaning (space vs the space).
rules.rule_text_uk: The може означати конкретну річ; a/an — один приклад. Іноді the змінює значення (space vs the space).
examples: A laptop is a tool; the laptop on the table is mine.
Space is huge. The space in my bag is small.
A river is long; the river here is polluted.

rules.rule_text_en: We say the cinema/the theatre, the radio, the internet, but we usually say TV (without the).
rules.rule_text_uk: Кажемо the cinema/the theatre, the radio, the internet, але зазвичай TV без the.
examples: We went to the cinema after work.
I listen to the radio in the car.

rules.rule_text_en: Without the: go to school/university etc. when we mean the activity (as a student).
rules.rule_text_uk: Без the: go to school/university тощо, коли маємо на увазі процес/роль (як студент).
examples: My son goes to school nearby.
He went to college in Canada.

rules.rule_text_en: With the: the school/the university etc. when we mean the building or a particular place.
rules.rule_text_uk: З the: the school/the university тощо, коли маємо на увазі будівлю або конкретне місце.
examples: I’ll meet you at the school gate.

rules.rule_text_en: In common expressions we often say go home, be at work, go to bed (no the).
rules.rule_text_uk: У сталих виразах часто кажемо go home, be at work, go to bed (без the).
rules.rule_short_en: Fixed phrases: go home / to bed.
rules.rule_short_uk: Сталi вирази: go home / to bed.
examples: I was tired, so I went to bed early.
She was at work all day.

rules.rule_text_en: For things/people in general, use plural or uncountable nouns without the.
rules.rule_text_uk: Коли говоримо загалом, вживаємо множину або незлічувані іменники без the.

rules.rule_text_en: Even with a description, we can mean a general category: people who…, coffee with milk…, etc. (still no the).
rules.rule_text_uk: Навіть з уточненням можна мати на увазі категорію загалом: people who…, coffee with milk… (все ще без the).
examples: I admire people who stay calm.
I don’t like food with too much salt.

rules.rule_text_en: Use the for a specific group/thing, often with extra information (the people I work with, the coffee we had).
rules.rule_text_uk: Вживай the для конкретної групи/речі, часто з уточненням (the people I work with, the coffee we had).
examples: I like the people in my class.
The music you played was great.
The car we rented was tiny.

rules.rule_text_en: We can use the + singular countable noun to talk about a type/species/invention (not one specific example).
rules.rule_text_uk: Можна вживати the + злічуваний в однині, щоб говорити про тип/вид/винахід (не про конкретний екземпляр).
examples: The elephant is a very intelligent animal.

rules.rule_text_en: We normally use the with musical instruments: play the guitar/piano/violin etc.
rules.rule_text_uk: З музичними інструментами зазвичай вживаємо the: play the guitar/piano/violin тощо.
examples: He plays the drums in a band.

rules.rule_text_en: We use the with some nationality words (the Swiss, the Portuguese). With others we use a plural -s (Italians).
rules.rule_text_uk: З деякими назвами національностей вживаємо the (the Swiss, the Portuguese). З іншими — множину на -s (Italians).
examples: The Swiss are famous for watches.

rules.rule_text_en: We do not use the with most names of continents, countries, cities, islands and mountains.
rules.rule_text_uk: З більшістю назв континентів, країн, міст, островів і гір the не вживається.

rules.title_en: The with Republic/Kingdom/States and plural names
rules.rule_text_en: We often use the in names with Republic/Kingdom/States etc. and with plural names (the United States, the Netherlands).
rules.rule_text_uk: The часто вживається в назвах із Republic/Kingdom/States тощо та з назвами у множині (the United States, the Netherlands).
examples: They live in the United States.
I’d like to visit the Czech Republic.
The Netherlands is famous for canals.

rules.title_en: North/south: in the south vs northern Spain
rules.rule_text_en: We say in the north/south/east/west, but we usually say northern Spain / western Canada (no the).
rules.rule_text_uk: Кажемо in the north/south/east/west, але зазвичай northern Spain / western Canada (без the).
examples: Spain is in the south of Europe.
She lives in the west of the country.

rules.rule_text_en: We usually don’t use the with names of streets, roads, squares and parks (Union Street, Hyde Park).
rules.rule_text_uk: З назвами вулиць/доріг/площ/парків зазвичай не вживаємо the (Union Street, Hyde Park).
examples: The hotel is on Fifth Avenue.

rules.title_en: Institutions named with place/person: usually no the
rules.rule_text_en: Names like Manchester Airport or Harvard University are usually without the when the first word is a name.
rules.rule_text_uk: Назви типу Manchester Airport або Harvard University зазвичай без the, якщо перше слово — назва місця/людини.
examples: We changed trains at Victoria Station.

rules.rule_text_en: Many newspapers and organisations use the: the BBC, the European Union, the Red Cross, the Times.
rules.rule_text_uk: Багато газет і організацій вживають the: the BBC, the European Union, the Red Cross, the Times.
examples: I read the Financial Times online.
He works for the Red Cross.

rules.rule_text_en: Company and airline names are usually without the (Sony, IBM, Singapore Airlines).
rules.rule_text_uk: Назви компаній і авіаліній зазвичай без the (Sony, IBM, Singapore Airlines).

rules.rule_text_en: Words like trousers, glasses, scissors are plural and take a plural verb. You can say a pair of trousers/glasses etc.
rules.rule_text_uk: Слова trousers, glasses, scissors — множинні й вимагають дієслово в множині. Можна сказати a pair of trousers/glasses тощо.
rules.rule_short_en: Trousers are; a pair of trousers.
rules.rule_short_uk: Trousers are; a pair of trousers.
examples: I bought a pair of sunglasses.

rules.rule_text_en: Police is a plural word: The police are … . For one person we say a police officer.
rules.rule_text_uk: Police — множинне слово: The police are … . Для однієї людини кажемо a police officer.
examples: The police are looking for a witness.

rules.rule_text_en: We usually use people as the plural of person (not persons in normal speech).
rules.rule_text_uk: Зазвичай множина від person — people (не persons у звичайній мові).

rules.rule_text_en: We treat sums of money, time and distance as one thing, so we often use a singular verb: Ten minutes is …
rules.rule_text_uk: Суми грошей, час і відстань часто сприймаємо як одне ціле, тому часто вживаємо однину: Ten minutes is …

rules.rule_text_en: Two nouns can go together to mean one thing (bus driver, city centre). The first noun describes the type.
rules.rule_text_uk: Два іменники можуть утворювати одну назву (bus driver, city centre). Перший іменник описує тип.
rules.rule_short_en: bus driver = driver of a bus.
examples: My brother is a taxi driver.

rules.rule_text_en: The first noun can be a place/person: a Paris hotel, a Shakespeare play. It works like an adjective.
rules.rule_text_uk: Першим іменником може бути назва місця/людини: a Paris hotel, a Shakespeare play. Він працює як прикметник.
rules.rule_short_en: a Paris hotel; a Shakespeare play.
rules.rule_short_uk: a Paris hotel; a Shakespeare play.
examples: We stayed in a London hotel.

rules.rule_text_en: Measurements used as adjectives are singular and often hyphenated: a three-hour journey, a four-week course.
rules.rule_text_uk: Міри як прикметники вживаються в однині й часто через дефіс: a three-hour journey, a four-week course.
